comments.author: KrisBash
comments.body: We’ve done a lot of work to get to a point where we only have one OMI daemon on the system for all use cases (SC, DSC, OMS). I think it’s desirable to make sure that any necessary changes to OMI get into the upstream OMI and we use the existing OMI packages for this. Is that consistent with your plans?

comments.author: andschwa
andschwa
comments.body: I've seen OMI packages, just need to figure out how to create them outside of other projects. @jeffaco, @niroyb pointed me to `installbuilder`, but I can't find any script or make target to produce a deb/rpm for OMI, do you know how?

comments.author: jeffaco
comments.body:
We have no builder of OMI packages that can be run stand-alone. Well, sort of.

The actual installbuilder files for OMI are checked into OMI itself. But you need to be careful on how to configure OMI to work with our products. Otherwise, you can have an OMI that installs into "our" directory (/opt/omi), yet it won't work with our products. That would be a disaster.

There are only two places that I'm aware of where this is actually built: SCX and DSC.

Both are fairly light-weight projects. If you just did a "configure --enable-ulinux; make" in SCXcore, you'd get what you needed. But if you were willing to check out SCXcore, I could give you a few targeted commands to JUST build OMI.

Is that enough for you? Or do you need something more?

What if you took any of the output packages up on the build share for SCX, and ran the shell bundle with `--extract`. If you did this, you'd get an up-to-date version of OMI as well (from the master branch).

I'd suggest you stop by, tell me exactly what you need, and I'll work with you to satisfy your needs.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
Ideally, we wouldn't take a dependency on SCXCore or DSC in order to build an OMI package for PowerShell. My goal is to get an OMI "2.0" Debian package that the PowerShell package and @paulcallen's PSRP provider can take a dependency on. Thus a `master` branch build isn't enough; I need to make one for the `psrp/features` branch (and be able to make new ones as it gets updated).

It sounds like OMI is incapable of producing its own packages, is this something we can remedy?

comments.author: jeffaco
comments.body:
I could give you specific 'make' instructions on how to build OMI. Note that you would need to take a dependency on project "pal" (this is a public repo), as that's where installbuilder happens to live. If we moved that, that would impact a bunch of projects (SCXcore, dsc, apache, mysql, ...)

@KrisBash Are you okay with PowerShell building OMI themselves, assuming they use identical build steps to what SCXcore does?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: This issue is covering several things that should be separate. OMI and PSRP packages are being discussed externally in email threads with @paulcallen, @jeffaco, and @palladia; I'll let them figure out tracking. Separately from that, package feeds for PowerShell don't seem to be in our scope any more, I believe the intention is to ship the packages in the official feeds. @joeyaiello, @KrisBash, is this right?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Until @KrisBash can resolve the questions around official feeds, I'm closing this with #1279.
